Thisbrings the Scottish total to 40 - 9 members of the crew of the ship onwhich the outbreak originated, one passenger, and 30 civilians. 7 have died,including 2 members of the crew.In addition to the Swindon case previously mentioned, one other casearose independently in England associated with the Glasgow outbreak, of aGlasgow woman who developed the disease in London on 21st July three days after travelling from Glasgow,The majority of the cases to date developed at the end of June and the"beginning of July. Since 10th July only 3 certain pases have been diagnosed,with a fourth where the diagnosis is not free from doubt.Approximately 500,000 persons have been vaccinated in Glasgow, 32,000 inAyrshire, and considerable numbers in Lanarkshire, Renfrewshire, and othercounties likely to be affected by the outbreak.
